{"step_by_step_thinking": "Calculus is a hard deposit that forms on the teeth due to the mineralization of dental plaque. Altered cementum refers to changes in the outer layer of the tooth root. Both calculus and altered cementum can affect the health of the tooth and surrounding tissues. The portion of the tooth covered by calculus or altered cementum is commonly referred to as the deposit zone.", "answer_choice": "B. Deposit zone"}
